prompts.proposer: Call proposer_brief_tool() FIRST. Then select candidates by name and choose a score_preset. Return ONLY JSON per instructions. IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY reference candidate names that appear in the tool output candidate_library; unknown names will hard-stop.
prompts.skeptic:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]
current_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5"]
prompts.statistician:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).

raw.proposer:
{
  "selected_names": ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5"],
  "params_overrides": {},
  "score_preset": "balanced",
  "force_debate": false,
  "debate_margin": 0.0,
  "rationale": "Validation shows horizon-specific model performance variations (10 unique winners across 12 horizons). Baseline_mean provides stability, best_per_horizon_by_validation leverages past validation insights, and topk_mean_per_horizon_k5 balances diversity with performance by averaging top 5 models per horizon."
}

proposer.rationale: Validation shows horizon-specific model performance variations (10 unique winners across 12 horizons). Baseline_mean provides stability, best_per_horizon_by_validation leverages past validation insights, and topk_mean_per_horizon_k5 balances diversity with performance by averaging top 5 models per horizon.

skeptic.rationale: Ridge stacking and best_single_by_validation show superior RMSE/SMAPE in universe rankings. Baseline_mean underperforms relative to top candidates. Increasing shrinkage/l2 improves stability, trim_ratio adjustment aligns with recommended knobs for few-window scenarios.

changes.name: baseline_mean
changes.reason: Lower score (0.927) vs topk_mean_per_horizon_k5 (0.924) and best_per_horizon_by_validation (0.9897)

changes.name: topk_mean_per_horizon_k5
changes.reason: Recommended stronger regularization for few-window scenarios

changes.name: topk_mean_per_horizon_k5
changes.reason: Lower l2 improves stability without sacrificing performance

changes.name: best_per_horizon_by_validation
changes.reason: Slight trim adjustment aligns with recommended knobs

skeptic.when_good: When window count is low (n_windows=3) and stability is prioritized over marginal performance gains

statistician.rationale: Current ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5 is unstable (rmse_std_over_rmse=0.32). Adding ridge_stacking_l250_topk3 aligns with recommended_knobs (l2=50, top_k=3). best_single_by_validation's top_k=5 is suboptimal for n_windows=3; reducing to 3 improves stability. trim_ratio=0.1 matches recommended_knobs for topk_mean_per_horizon_k5.

changes.name: ridge_stacking_l250_topk3
changes.reason: Matches recommended_knobs (l2=50, top_k=3) for stability with n_windows=3

changes.name: best_single_by_validation
changes.reason: Recommended top_k=3 for n_windows=3 improves stability

changes.name: topk_mean_per_horizon_k5
changes.reason: Recommended trim_ratio=0.1 for stability with few windows

statistician.when_good: When n_windows is small (≤5), stronger regularization (l2=50, shrinkage=0.25) and trim_ratio=0.1 improve stability without sacrificing performance.
